Field Detail

mouseFocusOn

public static GComponent mouseFocusOn
If this is null then no GUI component has the mouse focus, otherwise it references the object that has the focus. It must be set to null on mouse released event.

keyFocusOn

public static GComponent keyFocusOn
If this is null then no GUI component has the text focus, otherwise it references the object that has the focus. It must be set to null on mouse released event.

public static GColor globalColor

                  int x,

GComponent

public GComponent(processing.core.PApplet theApplet,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  GColor cScheme,
                  GFont fScheme)
This constructor should be called by all constructors of any child class e.g. GPanel, GLabel etc. Create a local color/font scheme and use for global if that has not been defined yet.

Parameters:

y -

getID

public java.lang.String getID()

the unique ID for this component

draw

public void draw()
Override in child classes

mouseEvent

public void mouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
Override in child classes. Every object will execute this method when an event is to be processed.

add

public boolean add(GComponent component)
This is the default implementation for all GUI components except GPanel since we can use panels to group data.

Parameters:
component - to be added (ignored)
Returns:
false always

isOver

public boolean isOver(int ax,
                      int ay)
Determines whether the position ax, ay is over this component. This is the default implementation and assumes the component is a rectangle where x & y is the top-left corner and the size is defined by width and height. Override this method where necessary in child classes e.g. GPanel

Parameters:
ax - mouse x position
ay - mouse y position
Returns:
true if mouse is over the component else false

calcAbsPosition

public void calcAbsPosition(java.awt.Point d)
This method will calculate the absolute top left position of this component taking into account any ancestors.

Parameters:
d -

constrain

public int constrain(int v,
                     int min,
                     int max)
Constrain a value to stay within a range.

Parameters:
v - the value to constrain
min - range minimum value
max - range maximum value
Returns:
the constrained value

setBorder

public void setBorder(int border)
The user can add a border by specifying it's thickness a value of 0 means no border (this is the default)

Parameters:
border - width in pixels
